properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 1 at 10:53PM CST by NWS Springfield MO
properties.description:
At 1053 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near
Miller, or 8 miles northeast of Mount Vernon, moving east at 25 mph.

Nickel size hail and wind gusts up to 50 mph will be possible with
this storm.

Locations impacted include...
Springfield...                    Republic...
Battlefield...                    Willard...
Brookline...                      Halltown...
Chesapeake...                     Glidewell...
Ebenezer...                       Bois D'arc...
Galloway...

This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 48 and 82.
properties.instruction:
This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio
stations and available television stations for additional information
and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm, and may lead
to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded
roadways.

NWSheadline: SIGNIFICANT WEATHER ADVISORY FOR NORTHEASTERN LAWRENCE AND WESTERN GREENE COUNTIES UNTIL MIDNIGHT CST
